Ethics inquiry urged into Tierney disclosures

Nonpartisan groups want US Rep. John F. Tierney to be investigated for not disclosing more than $200,000 received by his wife, which he asserts was a gift. (Globe)

'Blade Runner' Pistorius making history

The first amputee to compete in track at the Olympics, Oscar Pistorius of South Africa cruised past an opponent or two in his 400-meter heat, and by the end, the "Blade Runner" advanced to the semifinals. (AP, 7:06 a.m.)

Shark sightings boosting business

While skittish swimmers may be less inclined to go for a dip in the ocean, officials and business owners say the shark publicity is actually boosting revenue. (Globe)
